description: This unit covers a holistic perspective of human factors in the field of interaction design. Students will investigate distinctive perspectives of human factors and review examples of how such factors affect users' behaviour and design solutions. By examining physical, cognitive, cultural and social factors related to the target user groups, students will critically analyse the design motives, methods, processes and results.
faculty: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture
